result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Tyler J. Guibord was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Re-sentence

01:59 PM Judge Kelly McKnight appearing by video from Ashland County.  Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in court appearing by video from Oshkosh Correctional, with attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appearing by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video.    Appearances by conferencing through Zoom due to Covid-19.  
Court sets the record.  Court states the only issue in front of it today is confinement.  
Atty Poquette recites the agreement:  3 years initial incarceration, 3 years extended supervision; concurrent to Wood County case 18CF38.   
Atty Schieffer requests breakout session for opportunity to speak privately with DE- court grants.
Off the record 2:03 pm
2:09 pm.  Back on the record.
Atty Schieffer states the DE approves of the agreement as recited by the State.  Defendant knowingly waives his right to personal appearance and approves of video appearance.
Atty Poquette makes statement, notes an error on revocation summary, Court finds it is irrelevant to this sentencing.
2:22 pm Atty Schieffer makes statement- approves of State's recitation of agreement:  3 years initial incarceration and 3 years extended supervision.
Defendant makes statement.
2:28 Court statement.  Finds concurrent sentence would be inappropriate, but does not feel it needs to be lengthy consecutive sentence.  

Court Sentences:   One year initial incarceration, One year extended supervision consecutive to any other sentence being served.  Eligible for both programs. Conditions of extended supervision:   Absolute Sobriety  AODA assessment and follow-through with recommendations  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.
DNA has already been ordered,  felony warnings already given, IID and revocation already ordered.  Financial obligations if not ordered so already are to be converted to civil judgment.
State:  235 days credit, Atty Schieffer stipulated.
Court grants 235 days credit.
Sentencing hearing on June 12, 2020 at 01:45 pm.
Provided two certified copies to the Sheriff
Sentencing hearing on June 12, 2020 at 01:45 pm.
As per request from Judge McKnight's office, ALL of the April 2020 hearings have been removed from the Court's calendar.  Judge McKnight's Jucidial Assistant will be rescheduling. mak
Motion hearing-1/24/20
Sentencing hearing on April 23, 2020 at 11:00 am.

Order regarding Post-conviction Motion

1:02 PM Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Defendant Tyler J. Guibord in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing on post-conviction motion.  Atty Peterson calls Atty Christian Ness as a witness.  Sworn in by the Clerk.  Testifies.
1:16 pm cross by Atty Poquette.  No redirect.  Atty Ness is excused and released.
Attorney's stipulate that comments made at sentencing hearing by Atty Marcoux were a breach of the plea agreement.  
Court agrees.
Atty Peterson requests that there be a new Judge assigned, the State agrees.  Local PD should be appointed for the re-sentencing.

Court is satisfied that there was a breach of the plea agreement.  Court grants motion for new sentencing before New Judge.

Atty Peterson will draft Order.  DE is remanded back to the prison system for other sentence being served.
